Class DialogBuilder<D extends javafx.scene.control.Dialog<R>, B extends DialogBuilder<D,B,R>, R>

java.lang.Object
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.abstract_builders.DialogPaneBuilder<D,B,R>
com.dua3.utility.fx.controls.abstract_builders.DialogBuilder<D,B,R>
Type Parameters:
D - the type of dialog box to build
B - the type of the builder class itself
R - the type of the result returned by the dialog box
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlertBuilder, InputDialogBuilder, OptionsDialogBuilder, PromptBuilder
public abstract class DialogBuilder<D extends javafx.scene.control.Dialog<R>, B extends DialogBuilder<D,B,R>, R> extends DialogPaneBuilder<D,B,R>
Abstract class for building dialog boxes.

  • Constructor Details

    • DialogBuilder

      protected DialogBuilder(MessageFormatter formatter, @Nullable javafx.stage.Window parentWindow)
      Constructs a DialogBuilder with an optional parent window.
      Parameters:
      formatter - the MessageFormatter to use
      parentWindow - the parent window for the dialog, or null if no parent is specified

  • Method Details

    • title

      public B title(String fmt, Object... args)
      Set dialog title.
      Parameters:
      fmt - the format String as defined by Formatter
      args - the arguments passed to the formatter
      Returns:
      this

    • resizable

      public B resizable(boolean flag)
      Sets whether the dialog should be resizable.
      Parameters:
      flag - a boolean indicating whether the dialog should be resizable. true makes the dialog resizable, while false makes it non-resizable.
      Returns:
      the current builder instance of type B, to allow method chaining

    • modality

      public B modality(javafx.stage.Modality modality)
      Set the modality of the dialog.
      Parameters:
      modality - the modality to set
      Returns:
      the current builder instance of type B, to allow method chaining

    • showAndWait

      public Optional<R> showAndWait()
      Build and show the dialog.

      This is equivalent to calling build().showAndWait().

      Returns:
      Optional containing the result as defined by the dialog

    • build

      public D build()
      Create a new Dialog instance.
